name: Crockett Hotel

reviews.text: Our high school class of 1971 decided to get together to celebrate our 60th birthdays and I contacted the Crockett Hotel. Having stayed there many times before for both business and pleasure, I was already familiar with their service, amenities, and great location. But this time, they were over the top! From the first phone call to the last day of our party (months later), the entire staff at the Crockett was exceptional. They are the friendliest, most accommodating group in San Antonio (and I've stayed at dozens of other hotels in San Antonio in the past). Shirley (sales) went out of her way to show me all the rooms available and handled all our reservations personally. Eduardo and Oralia (front desk) were always smiling and went way above and beyond to accommodate all our needs and requests. Alphonso (security) found our forgotten stereo and locked it up safely until we returned. Gil and Daniel (valet) were also extremely helpful with baggage, cars, transportation, and just about anything else we needed. Margaret (office) was always there to assist and provided invaluable suggestions about our set-up and arrangements. Everything was perfect. I really can't thank them enough for making our long weekend event a truly memorable experience. The free continental breakfast is much better than anywhere else, the drinks at the bar are good (and the long happy hour has excellent prices). The location of the Crockett is the best one in town. It's right behind the Alamo and within walking distance of all the downtown attractions. The San Antonio Trolley is just across the street and the CVB is a block away, so you are in the center of everything. And finally, the Crockett is a little slice of San Antonio history - over 100 years old (great old photos on the lobby walls), yet modern, spotlessly clean and completely comfortable - it felt like we were staying with friends. If you want a great view and a spacious suite, ask for room 202 - where LBJ and Lady Bird stayed when in San Antonio. We've already booked rooms for Fiesta in April!
reviews.title: High School Class Birthday Party

reviews.text: We stayed at the Crockett for 3 Nights and it is so great to have a hotel so near to the Alamo and the river walks it was great.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: You don't get served breakfast it is self serv but the eggs are great and the waffles you can do are great. There is fruit yoghurt fruit and toast plus cakes it is plenty. We went on the boats it is so good 15 dollars each for a 24 hour pass on the water taxi each it was worth every penny we had two great rides day & in the dark. We felt very safe and happy. Our room w a good size great bed view over the Alamo that is just over the road.
reviews.title: Attention seminar atendees!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Crockett Hotel for a four-day meeting which was held at San Antonio convention center. The hotel was not listed in the convention webpage; nevertheless, I decided to book a room at the Crockett due to its character, proximity and breakfast service. I was told that it is located two blocks from the convention center; however, most of the walk is indoor the Riverwalk Mall (the Hotel is just across the street from the mall), and inside the lobby of the Marriott Riverwalk. I was pleased with everything: the lobby, the spacious rooms with plantation shutters overlooking at the corridor and of course, the breakfast. I highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Customer Service...Not Really.

reviews.text: My stay was early in the summer. I was there on business and my bride was with me. Until this trip, I loved The Crockett Hotel. What, you ask, could have so soured me on a venue I was so enamored with? Let me elaborate. I had finished the business portion of my stay and my wife and I were now going to enjoy San Antonio on a personal level. Keep this bit of information in the back of your mind, Texas has really large cockroaches and we had seen them outside the Hotel (which was ok) and also in the elevator twice (which was not ok). The third morning of our stay, we get up and prepared to do sight seeing in this gorgeous town. I'm up and dressed. My wife is in the bathroom getting ready. I go around the corner to make a cup of coffee when I hear a blood curdling scream. At first, I thought she may have shocked herself in the bathroom. As I ran around the corner, I see the item that has so elevated the decibels in the room. There was one of those really large cockroaches on my wife's pillow. As you may have guessed, my wife is deathly afraid of bugs, and cokroaches are one of the worst. I do what any good spouse does, I go in the bathroom, grab a bunch of toilet paper and catch him. This is where the luster quickly comes off the Crockett for me. We finished getting ready and go down to the desk, cockroach in hand. I tell the young lady at the desk the scenario we just experienced and she was mortified (she told us she too was scared to death of those things). She tried to make the situation right, to no avail.
reviews.title: Convenient location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Love everything about this hotel! The location is perfect and the hotel has amazing historic energy!!! The Crockett Hotel and Menger Hotel are owned by the same people. The rooms are larger at the Crockett. I read several reviews that said the Crockett was noisy, but our room was right above the bar and lobby and was much more quiet than some 5-star hotels that we've stayed at. I can't imagine paying $100 a night for a room, located within walking distance of the Riverwalk, with the cleanliness and atmosphere of the Crockett and writing a bad review. We had planned to stay at a bed and breakfast, but there was not availability...but we are so happy we stumbled upon the Crockett. My boyfriend and I honestly loved everything about this place and will most definitely stay here during all future stays in San Antonio!
reviews.title: Great value, great location, great history

reviews.text: It really saddens me to write this review... I want to say only good things... But we were fairly dissapionted in our recent stay. The room was awesome-large, clean, etc... But so many small things were just not up to par. Check-in was difficult- we had requested a mini fridge (which was in the room, no problem there). When given the total for our stay, I SPECIFICALLY asked the desk staff if the total included cost for fridge... Yes, I was told... Card was processed, then I was told that she wasn't sure if fridge was included or not, so she needed to re-run my card for fridge- then I should check my records... & if I was overcharged, I should contact them to fix it later... REALLY?!? You can't tell if I've been charged the right amount- that's kind of your job, isn't it?!? Also, they did not provide us with enough breakfast tickets... Ironically, the day we ran out of tickets, our door keys quit working. We figured that she must have gotten our check-out date wrong in the system (even though we were charged for the correct amount of nights!)... When having to re-key our cards, it was an over 20 minute wait, due to the line in front of us... NOT a good experience- the bar was still nice, breakfast has gone downhill in quality from last year (I know that breakfast is a difficult thing to do, but really- warm milk & cottage cheese- we were afraid to ingest them, actually...but they did try, & a free morning meal is nice-)... Pool area was still enjoyable, but busy (NOT the hotel's fault)- could have been cleaner, & there were unattended, underaged children there many times... Again, not really the hotel's fault, but- if you have rules posted & guests inform you that the rules are being broken... MORE THAN ONCE- why is nothing done?!? We returned to the Crockett because we have had GREAT, OUTSTANDING service & stays in the past. We were REALLY looking forward to a nice, relaxing stay while on vacation... If this had been my 1st stay here, I would NOT be coming back... As it stands, we will prob give them one more chance. Maybe we just caught them at a bad time... But if service does not improve, I'm afraid that our affair w/the Crockett is over... :-(
reviews.title: Third Stay at the Crockett... Still Good, but Not Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't plan on getting any sleep while your here, day or night. There's too much noise inside the hotel to ever sleep. If someone is in the hallway you are going to hear them. The location is great, close to the Riverwalk, The Alamo, the IMAX. but inside the hotel doors are alway slamming. The air wakes you up when it comes on and when it cuts off. Again, it's nice but don't plan on ever sleeping
reviews.title: TOO MUCH NOISE

reviews.text: As titled, the property is in a great location, directly across the street from the Alamo and not five minutes from the Riverwalk. The room was pretty plain, but clean. Nice bathroom. The problem we had is that we were over the lobby area and it was very loud all night long. They also do a breakfast buffet. Their food was okay, but the space was way too small so the crowd totally overwhelmed it.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: We stayed there back in April which is a great time to visit San antonio as it is la fiesta time
reviews.title: Bad service great location

reviews.text: I had no idea when I planned our trip that we were reserving such an awesome place to stay! The room was beautiful, the view was awesome and the front desk people were AMAZING! The suite had connecting doors so you can connect with the room next door, if you have kids and the only draw back was that our neighbors were a little noisy. Other than that, this hotel was AMAZING!
reviews.title: Awesome Stay!

reviews.text: The location of the historic Crockett is the best thing about this hotel. You are right across the street from the Alamo, across the street from the huge mall (behind the steak house sign) and a block or two from the Riverwalk.
reviews.title: Nice historic hotel great location behind the Alamo

reviews.text: The staff was wonderful including one gentleman who always remembered my name when he saw me (and I have a very hard last name for most people to pronounce, I was very impressed by this!).
reviews.title: Right behind the Alamo. Easy walk to the riverwalk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was clean. Some may find the lack of heavy curtains on the windows allowing too much sun in the room (they have a thick wooden blinds); also the bed was a little too firm for me, but I did get used to it. Otherwise, the room was always very clean as well as the bathroom.
reviews.title: Good, but not great....

reviews.text: There was no microwave or small refrigerator in the room--I don't know if the Crockett has rooms like that but I did not request one. As I was out touring most of the day and night, it did not prove to be a big issue for me. There were no laundry facilities, but again I cleaned my clothes with some soap and water and allowed them to dry over the bathtub. It worked O.K. The outside pool was small in size, but still OK with only 2 or 3 people in it.
reviews.title: Unexpected gem

reviews.text: There are good things and not so good things to say about the Crockett Hotel
reviews.title: Glass half empty or half full?

reviews.text: Good- Start with location, it is right next to the Alamo. You can walk out a door of the Crockett, cross the street, and there is the back entrance to the Alamo. The Riverwalk mall entrance was across the street, too. The included breakfast was quite good and had enough choices for most people. The staff is extremely friendly and wants to help if necessary
reviews.title: Great price, great location!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not so good- The rooms are very small, barely enough room for the 2 full-size beds. There is NO space to put one's toiletries at the sink. I was forced to use the window sills. Finally, although this is not a big deal, there was a constant humming noise that seemed to becoming from the Riverwalk Mall exhaust fans. These happened to be located on the side I was staying.
reviews.title: Decent Stay

reviews.text: I am not sure if I would stay here again, but I would not rule it out, either
reviews.title: Great location, basic hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a nice hotel for the price and the location!! Some things to plan for, Valet parking in ADDITION to your stay. It is $20 which is REALLY reasonable for that side of town BUT I wish I knew when I was shopping for the best place and price to stay. Other than that, it was VERY clean, had a Neat bar with very reasonable drink prices. It is an older hotel, but update very nicely! Valet parking was also VERY prompt, never taking more than 10-15 minutes. Just call them while you are getting ready. This is RIGHT across from the Alamo, and within SHORT walking distance of the river walk. It has nice free wifi, and the free breakfast was good. Had Waffles, omeletes, some fruit and fruit juices.
reviews.title: great location
